Detailed Description

Common definitions and functions to manipulate a sparse graph of an image.

The data structure assumes that the arcs are defined by an adjacency relation invariant to translation.

Defines an image graph where the arc weights between neighboring pixels p and q are computed as the Euclidean distance (L2 norm), between the color vectors I(p) and I(q), plus one.

◆ ByWeightImage()

sImageGraph * gft::ImageGraph::ByWeightImage ( sImage32 *  W,
float  r 
)

Defines an image graph where the arc weights between neighboring pixels p and q are computed as W(p) + W(q)+1, where W is an image of weights in pixel resolution. W(p) is usually calculated as the magnitude of the gradient at pixel p.

◆ ChangeType()

void gft::ImageGraph::ChangeType ( sImageGraph *  sg,
int  type 
)

Changes the type of arc weights to DISSIMILARITY or CAPACITY. By changing the type, the arc weights are complemented/inverted.

The arc weights may represent a DISSIMILARITY or a CAPACITY between neighboring pixels, as generally used by the path-cost functions of Image Foresting Transform or by the min-cut/max-flow algorithm, respectively.

◆ ChangeWeight()

void gft::ImageGraph::ChangeWeight ( sImageGraph *  sg,

Replaces a given arc weight with a new value.

◆ IsUndirectedGraph()

bool gft::ImageGraph::IsUndirectedGraph ( sImageGraph *  sg)

Tests if the graph is an undirected graph. That is, it is a symmetric digraph and w(p, q) = w(q, p) for all arcs.

◆ KhalimskyGrid()

sImage32 * gft::ImageGraph::KhalimskyGrid ( sImageGraph *  sg)

Computes the Khalimsky grid of a saliency map.

A saliency map can be visualized through Khalimsky grids, only when its image graph is given by the 4-adjacency relation.

◆ Orient2Digraph()

void gft::ImageGraph::Orient2Digraph ( sImageGraph *  sg,
sImage32 *  img,
float  per 
)

Updates the weights of the arcs to incorporate the boundary polarity constraint.

It is usually used before computing the OIFT (Oriented Image Foresting Transform).

◆ Orient2DigraphInner()

void gft::ImageGraph::Orient2DigraphInner ( sImageGraph *  sg,
sImage32 *  P_sum 
)

Updates the weights of the arcs to incorporate the Geodesic Star Convexity constraint.

It is usually used before computing the OIFT (Oriented Image Foresting Transform).

)

Updates the weights of the arcs to incorporate the Geodesic Star Convexity constraint.

It is usually used before computing the OIFT (Oriented Image Foresting Transform).

◆ Transpose()

void gft::ImageGraph::Transpose ( sImageGraph *  sg)

Computes the transpose of a directed graph.

Transpose of a directed graph G is another directed graph on the same set of vertices with all of the arcs reversed compared to the orientation of the corresponding arcs in G. That is, if G contains an arc (u, v) with weight w(u, v)=k then its transpose G' contains an arc (v, u) with weight w'(v, u)=k and vice versa.

◆ WeightedMean()
